alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 10:02AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. .Additional snow melt will continue to lead to river flooding and elevated flows. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Prairie River near Taconite. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water level nears cabin on Lower Lawrence lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Monday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 05/01/1975. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Prairie River Taconite 10.0 11.2 Mon 9 am CDT 10.7 10.2 9.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 500 PM CDT.
